clinical_study.brief_title: Passive Leg Raising and Fluid Responsiveness
clinical_study.official_title: Passive Leg Raising 3.0 and Fluid Responsiveness

brief_summary.textblock: In the Intensive Care the Passive Leg Raising (PLR) test is a validated instrument to predict fluid responsiveness. In this study the investigators will try to prove the similarity of PLR test with a pillow and the PLR test with the patients bed in 45 degrees.

detailed_description.textblock: PLR test with pillow PLR test with bed to avoid a difference in results by the order of the measurements, the order of PLR testing is random.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from ICU admission until ICU discharge; test performed on the moment of clinical signs of fluid need through study completion, an average of 5 days
primary_outcome.description: are both PLR tests similar / comparable on fluid responsiveness
